website_summaries.verdict: Simple and sturdy design makes Garden Home the perfect choice for pipes in barns or outdoor sheds.
pros: Thick PVC outer lining is durable and can withstand light wear and tear in any weather conditions
Sturdy stainless steel fasteners are included to attach the cable to the pipes and valves
cons: Thicker pipes may require 2 cables to be installed-one on either side of the pipe

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: As advertised and seem very high quality. Will update if the pipes freeze when next we get into subzero temperatures. Edit: We hit subzero temperatures and these worked as expected. I could feel them heating up and the pipes did not freeze!
customer_reviews.author: mts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping chickens' water from freezing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep a chicken watering setup drinkable during winter. It arrived just before Winter Storm Helena pummeled southern Idaho, which really put it to the test. Even at -15 degrees, the water was not frozen at all. It was easy enough to install that my 6-year-old helped me. Very useful! Very simple!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Kilzer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a several barn style spigots around the ranch, but the most important one is in the barn. I've had a couple types of heating cables wrapped around the pipe over the years. None had seemed to keep the pipe from freezing once the temperature got to around zero. I thought I would give this one a try. What a remarkable difference this one made. We had -18 degrees and the water flowed with no issues. This order came with 2 cables. I have a spare if this one ever gives out. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kodra

customer_reviews.title: Well made heavy duty cable
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly made heavy duty cable. It appears to be quite abrasion resistant with all parts well sealed together. I can't speak for its longevity as I've only been using it for a few weeks. I appreciate the lighted plug so I know it's getting power. It's made to be used in a straight line along the pipes side, not wrapped around the pipe. I'm going to put some pipe insulation over it next time I go to the big box store to pick some up as I think this will make things safer from freezing and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: David AndersonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Like the cable, Hate the hardware. Overall quality product. You might buy a bag of "Easy Heat" brand hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two different sizes and therefore had to purchase two different brands. This one (Garden Home) seems heavier duty than the Easy Heat brand. However, the supplied hardware with the Garden Home was very hard to manipulate. The separators are stainless steel and spring back to their old shape when you try to close them on the cable. The Easy Heat hardware closes and stays clamped on the cable. I took most of my stainless ones off and used the softer ones from the Easy Heat. Overall the cable is good quality and seems to heat plenty when turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This item is a God-send. It works great. My only problem is that my kitchen hot water pipe is almost right up against the outside wall of my house. I couldn't get the cable in between the pipe and the wall so I installed it on the side of the pipe. It is zero degrees this morning at my home. The cable is nice and warm and I have hot water in my kitchen. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: First my error... this is not really ...
customer_reviews.text: First my error...this is not really a de-icing device as stated in the title/description but a ice prevention device...I guess that I was not critical enough in reviewing the product information..so the current ice dams will have to stay for the season and next Fall I will place this cable IF I can use an extension cord to connect between an outlet and the cable. It is not stated in the on-line description, but the pamphlet in the box said no extension cords! And the electrical outlet was to be within 6 feet of the first heating element...how many electrical outlets are within 6' of the roof? Bummer...will use an extension cord against the directives.
customer_reviews.author: phillip

customer_reviews.title: it's just what you need for when you need it
customer_reviews.text: You use electrical tape to wrap this against a pipe. Instructions note it should be the right length with no bends or kinks so don't get one too long. Thermostat must touch pipe against the coldest end. It turns itself on below 38°F works down to 15°F. Below that you need to also wrap the pipe in insulation. If you are installing this on the exposed main entry pipe of a trailer realize that there is usually an external outlet down under there near the pipe entry specifically for this sort of thing before you go to a bunch of trouble of trying to get an extension cord to there.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Works very well. Pipes didn't freeze.
customer_reviews.text: Really effective product. Just plug it in when weather turns cold and it does the job. The only thing I would change is the installation requirement that it be attached parallel to pipe on the bottom with zip ties or high temp electrical tape. The older product that I can no longer locate was spiraled around the pipe and secured on the ends. Otherwise, great product and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SAMitchell

customer_reviews.title: No Worries!
customer_reviews.text: Took about 20 minutes to coil the heated cable around the exposed pipe. The cable is stiff and tightly wrapped. I get frustrated working with it in tight spaces especially when there are multiple items close around the pipe to be wrapped. My wife handles it much better than I do! We have also used this cable to wrap a poultry water can with excellent results. Attached it to the under side of a chicken coop wire floor to help keep the girls keep warm. Love the thermostat so monitoring the use is taken care of via the outside temp.
customer_reviews.author: Dugualla

customer_reviews.title: Heated cable gives me piece of mind.
customer_reviews.text: I've got a sink in my garage that I use year-round. The garage is heated with a gas-fired heater in the far corner, but I keep the thermostat on it set to around 35 so as not to go broke. This heated cable was the perfect length to run down one of the sink water pipes, and back up the other side. With its built-in thermostat, it operates well to keep the pipes safely above freezing... and very economically.
customer_reviews.author: bohicaIL

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product makes it a no brainer for people with homes that have exposed water pipes and below freezing weather. Easy to install and will last at least three seasons, more if you use electric grease every couple months to keep oxidation away.
customer_reviews.author: DAD411

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I placed this on the outside faucet for our horse. I live in NEPA in a very cold, windy area. So far this winter the faucet has not frozen once, the water runs just like it was summer. It only added a couple dollars to our electric bill as it turns on only when it's needed. I'm very pleased with this purchase. This is the only thing I have on the faucet, no other weather protection, so it's doing a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan.
customer_reviews.text: I tried plugging one of the cables and it didn't work. I can't attest to anything else because it was a bum product and I needed something that day for my pipes.
customer_reviews.author: SweetDaesTop Contributor: My Little Pony

customer_reviews.title: Nice rugged cable with molded connections - should last a ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice rugged cable with molded connections - should last a long time. The spec of 5 amps is obviously wrong. I measured it at 19 *watts*, or 0.16 A. Strap it directly to the pipe and then wrap everything in insulation, and that should be plenty of heating power.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Local stores don't stock the 3 ft heat cable and I was glad to find this one. It arrived quickly and is just what I was needing for one short space in my wellhouse that freezes each winter. Like it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Long

customer_reviews.title: Great product easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Great product easy to install. Place this on intake line from the pool. Will update in a couple months when the weather get cold. Test the line before install by placing ice on the sensor and it work. For now will give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Normal consumer

customer_reviews.title: pending
customer_reviews.text: will install on a sink line that's had trouble freezing up in the past
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: You need this
customer_reviews.text: Easy install even sub freezing temps with high winds and exposed lines didnt freeze
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: I expect that the quality is every bit as good as the more expensive options available
customer_reviews.text: Installed this just before the snows set in. It works well. The construction is solid and the instructions are helpful. I expect that the quality is every bit as good as the more expensive options available. The one thing that might be improved is that the spacer wires are perhaps a little too long, since when I used them it was very difficult to get the cable down the downspouts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For pipes only
customer_reviews.text: Can't tell if they work properly until they're used, but you don't see the instructions for proper use until you receive the product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dirk

customer_reviews.title: Updated since Feb. 2017
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have had it 2 days now and it is working properly. I have no issues. Update 10 months later... Still working in 10 degree weather. I highly recommend this product. My pipes kept bursting in the laundry room. Since I purchased these cords, I have not had an issue yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, the seller was quick and painless ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, the seller was quick and painless. the one product upgrade request would be for the cord from the thermostat to the plug be longer. I don't know where you have an outlet that close to a water pipe near a cold area. But did what I wanted with extension cord.
customer_reviews.author: Strobel

customer_reviews.title: Clips
customer_reviews.text: Clips seem very flimsy and don't hold to the shingles well. You would think they would have a little more spring back to hold them tight. Should also have a different shaped clip for catching the side of shingles at an angle. I hope the cable doesn't blow off during any storms this winter.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peiffer

customer_reviews.title: When it works, can it's right.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had a picture of the old 10" pipe hanging out the side of the house with an old style spigget on the end. I wrapped my three foot of heating tape around it, wrapped a towel around that, shoved a boot over the whole thing, duct taped her down for good measure. That's what I call bootstrapped. Now it's water proof and warm, better than most winter jackets. The two day delivery was excellent, beat the weather by eight hours.
customer_reviews.author: 1Lilliputian

customer_reviews.title: Good Freeze Protection
customer_reviews.text: The pipe and valve heat tape is what I ordered. Really like that it is temp controlled, so only works when freezing temps are reached.
customer_reviews.author: John Horstketter

customer_reviews.title: TRY ANOTHER BRAND!!!  THIS ONE DOESN'T LAST!!
customer_reviews.text: I live at 9000 ft and it only lasted two winters. You can't tell me that's all it supposed to last. Don't bother with this one. Just try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: go20jets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size perfect price
customer_reviews.text: I like to move this around and it is easy to do so, I use it on my outside water spicket and it works out good
customer_reviews.author: Perry Fortin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs, but we'll see...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We've had some single digit temperatures this year, but we haven't yet hit the real deep freeze. For now, the pipes haven't frozen, and that's a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph L. Wahlstrom

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good price. Bought it as insurance against frozen pipes. Hope it works when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: There is a design flaw with the way the thermostat lays on the pipe I think. I put this on a small pipe under our sink - fastened it tightly with electrical tape. The next morning it was indeed working; but alas it never worked again. The pipe is frozen solid so no question that the temperature warrants heat.
customer_reviews.author: Kri Eli

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived earlier than promised! I like the idea of two short cables in one package. It worked as described and filled the need I had perfectly. Remember to not wrap the cable over itself. Well made!
customer_reviews.author: Sirwriter

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for my RV
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Kept my outdoor plumbing and water hookup from rupturing all winter.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Great item to keep my pipes from freezing this winter ...
customer_reviews.text: Great item to keep my pipes from freezing this winter thanks so much and the price was even better for the set. Thanks again for a wonderful product
customer_reviews.author: R. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: has done an excellent job keeping barn faucets running during the cold months. recommend
customer_reviews.author: c_croom

customer_reviews.title: It got really really cold and our water pump, ...
customer_reviews.text: It got really really cold and our water pump, hoses and pipes are under the wood deck. We put this on it and no busted pipes.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Well, so far my pipes have not frozen. ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, so far my pipes have not frozen. I believe we've had enough low temps over a long enough period of time that my pipes would have frozen (hard to know for sure). The wire is plenty long and in my case I used half on one pipe and then looped it back and used the rest on a 2nd pipe.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product I don't do any outdoor plumbing here where it freezes without including this product
customer_reviews.author: Floyd V.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect. Used on an outdoor poultry water line in the winter(wrapped with insulation).
customer_reviews.author: Chris F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't figure out why the well water wasn't flowing. Found out the pressure valve was exposed to severe cold. Used heat lamps until I got this baby. Haven't had an issue since! Plus I don't waste electricity running the lamp all day.
customer_reviews.author: Q public

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: One of these kept my large outside water filter from freezing
customer_reviews.author: Southern gal

customer_reviews.title: Live saver or pipe saver anyway
customer_reviews.text: Works just as advertised. Good quality product. I like that the orange portion of the plug lights up to indicate power is on. It saved my pipes so far. Have to buy a high temp electrical tape just to make sure the heat wrap stays to the pipe. I would most definitely recommend this product. It's with it
customer_reviews.author: A PAPA

customer_reviews.title: For the price these are a MUST have.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Installed on on the ends of a long frozen pipe and thawed it out in a few hours at 10 degrees outside.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McG

customer_reviews.title: Received as ordered
customer_reviews.text: Included directions indicate that the heating cable need not be wrapped around the pipes.
customer_reviews.author: Stieg Klein

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Comes with lots of clips and is long enough to do the entire roof with one cord. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Solved the problem
customer_reviews.text: We're well into winter now and the pipes that were a problem have not frozen so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jaggars

customer_reviews.title: Use this on a downspout. Kept the exit point ...
customer_reviews.text: Use this on a downspout. Kept the exit point clear of ice, which was enough to keep the water flowing.
customer_reviews.author: Gail F. Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.title: Good idea for exposed pipes.
customer_reviews.text: Wrapped up a backflow preventer on my irrigation system to keep the valve from freezing. It's less than half the cost of the valve!

customer_reviews.title: Hummingbird helper

customer_reviews.title: Avallance warning
customer_reviews.text: Only drawback on a metal roof is that it quickens the loosing of the snow pack on the roof and brings it all sliding down at once.

customer_reviews.text: Can’t wait to see my water bill! I read other reviews on amazon and laugh at people who complain over something for $10-20 not working, but there is a difference between not working and causing damage.

customer_reviews.title: 2 for 1 is better!

I was searching for a shorter than usual heat tape as my installation was warranted for such. The price was less than I had expected, so I ordered 2. Now I have a back-up and this should remedy my problem for several years.

product_meta.title: GardenHOME Cold Weather Valve and Pipe Heating Cable, 6 Feet, Black
product_meta.description: Size:6FeetDescription Say goodbye to frozen pipes in the winter with the GardenHome Pipe Heating Cable - 6 ft. (1.83 m). This temperature-controlled cable runs along pipes and valves, thawing frozen pipes. The built-in thermostat will sense the temperature of the pipe and turn the cable on and off to provide the most economical solution for frozen pipe disasters. How it Works Before applying the heating cable, make sure that the area on and around the pipe is clear and that the heating cable is warm and pliable. Simply plug the cable into the nearest grounded electrical receptacle, secure the thermostat tightly against the pipe with electrical tape, secure the heating cable straight along the pipe, and let the heating cable work its magic. The built-in thermostat will automatically detect the temperature of the pipe and turn the cable on when exposed to temperatures below 38F for frost-free pipes all winter long. It will shut the heating cable off when the pipe has been heated to a temperature of approximately 45F, incurring no extra electricity costs.
feature_bullets: SECURED PROTECTION: Prevents pipes from freezing. Effective for 6-8 feet (1. 83-2. 44 m) and up to 1-1 1/2 inches (25. 4-38. 1 mm) in diameter.
EASY INSTALLATION: Just put our Icebreaker heating cable along the pipes to keep ice and freezing away (Recommended for use on water-filled metal and rigid plastic pipes). Grounded cord and plug.

ENERGY SAVING THERMOSTAT CONTROLLED: In cold weather, the built-in thermostat can sense the temperature of the pipe. It turns the pipe freeze protection cable on at 38°F and turns it off automatically when the pipe has been heated to a temperature of approximately 45°F.
ECONOMICAL SOLUTION: Reliable low wattage design saves up to 70% energy than other cables and protects your cable to -50°F. Easy to install.
DURABLE MATERIAL: Weather resistant PVC outer jacket and inner insulation. It will operate for years without requiring maintenance. Provides peace of mind for homeowners.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars240 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
